Review: As an entomologist this game seems made for me. The butterflies are real species, the art and design are gorgeous, everything is in motion and feels alive, and the caterpillars are precious. I just came to give my 5star review because, aside from the game is just brilliant, dev team was quick to res...Full ReviewAs an entomologist this game seems made for me. The butterflies are real species, the art and design are gorgeous, everything is in motion and feels alive, and the caterpillars are precious. I just came to give my 5star review because, aside from the game is just brilliant, dev team was quick to respond to me wanting to transfer my game between phones without social media and did so with no issues, so thank you for that! I only wish we could name our butterflies but that might be kind of chaotic

Unfortunately I had to drop the game a year or so ago due to no longer having any room for butterflies. I have a fully expanded forest and no room to put any more. I was saddened by the fact I couldn't play to full capacity anymore and was hoping there would be an expansion update but its been over a year and there hasn't been. Still, its a nice game that's engaging and great to pass time and a brilliant way to calm down

Very nice game, leveling up takes patience, so sit back and enjoy the 
graphics. One thing I would like to do is to stop the dialog box opening up 
every time I touch a butterfly to gather honeydew. I can't see a setting to 
switch this to a long press, for example. Also, and perhaps this is me 
pla...Full ReviewVery nice game, leveling up takes patience, so sit back and enjoy the 
graphics. One thing I would like to do is to stop the dialog box opening up 
every time I touch a butterfly to gather honeydew. I can't see a setting to 
switch this to a long press, for example. Also, and perhaps this is me 
playing the game wrong, when I touch a flower or caterpillar to see how 
long to wait for it to finish its process, it would be nice to just see the 
remaining time pop up instead of all the extra detail.

Great game for education and just for butterfly lovers in general. 
Although, I find Starlight slightly better since it costs so much to expand 
your forest and I often find myself stuck where my storage and the forest 
is full so I'm stuck until I expand. I like the concept of butterflies 
having s...Full ReviewGreat game for education and just for butterfly lovers in general. 
Although, I find Starlight slightly better since it costs so much to expand 
your forest and I often find myself stuck where my storage and the forest 
is full so I'm stuck until I expand. I like the concept of butterflies 
having special abilities when they reach max level though, certainly makes 
the game easier and fixes the money problem. I like how there's an event 
every month for Flutter, Starlight and Splash. If you have all 3, there's 
basically always an event happening! Furistas Cat Caf√© is pretty good 
considering its technically still in Alpha/Beta. Keep up the great work!

mechanics and low pressure play.

Fell in love with this immediately, and played it non-stop for an embarrassing amount of time. But it's gotten repetitive. Same events, same extremely expensive in game purchases (both cash and free methods). Would be nice to see a new form of event in the future, or a new feature. It's still someth...Full ReviewFell in love with this immediately, and played it non-stop for an embarrassing amount of time. But it's gotten repetitive. Same events, same extremely expensive in game purchases (both cash and free methods). Would be nice to see a new form of event in the future, or a new feature. It's still something I pull out when I'm bored but it's certainly no longer something that keeps me playing for hours every day like I used to. Shame. As it's a beautiful game, well made and functions well. It would just be nice to see something a bit different to add a bit of life to it again. Personally I'd love to be able to cross breed butterflies (obviously that doesn't fit in with the scientifically accurate theme of the game) but just something new, to spark my interest again. Or being able to sell butterflies for flutter bucks as well as gold to make expansion more manageable, allowing players to more easily collect every butterfly. I hate games that satisfy the urge to collect. Then make it near impossible to actually KEEP the things you've earned. In this case all the butterflies.

I actually really enjoyed this game and also found the one event I participated in up til now fun. My main point of criticism is that the game does not provide a lot of information. For example regarding the new event: It was written nowhere in the game, that the flowers collected would vanish after...Full ReviewI actually really enjoyed this game and also found the one event I participated in up til now fun. My main point of criticism is that the game does not provide a lot of information. For example regarding the new event: It was written nowhere in the game, that the flowers collected would vanish after the event. I went to check out the Facebook page a couple of hours before the end of the event and found this out, much to my dismay. Over the whole event I had collected lots and lots of flowers, but was busy with growing other butterflies, which is why I delayed attracting event butterflies til after the event. Now it is apparent, that I will not achieve my goal, due to the flowers vanishing. It would have been very nice to have had this info when starting the event. Otherwise I believe Flutter to be a very enjoyable game, especially since it doesn't demand constant attention.  It is also quite informative, the butterflies you can gain have nicely made info pages, that tell a bit about their real life counterparts.

I downloaded this game for my daughter but ended up playing myself!  I love it!   It is so very relaxing, the music just eases tension immediately.  It has enough activities to keep it fun and interesting, at a nice slow, easy, enjoyable pace.  You can play without purchase but you will want to spen...Full ReviewI downloaded this game for my daughter but ended up playing myself!  I love it!   It is so very relaxing, the music just eases tension immediately.  It has enough activities to keep it fun and interesting, at a nice slow, easy, enjoyable pace.  You can play without purchase but you will want to spend on this one.  The butterflies are so gorgeous and the animation is really great.  Not some corny click game, you can tell an artist put a lot of time into this game, one who is a definite butterfly enthusiast.  One of the most motivating parts of gameplay is getting prizes often through accomplishments.   I really like how generous they are.  It let's you experience more of the game so you can decide where to spend your money if you choose to pay to play.   I don't usually take the time to review but I did the first time this game asked me to, which was after about 7 days of game play!!!  Not every 7 seconds like some games.  Highly recommend.   To the dev's: thank you and great job!  Only one critique: I wish there was a confirmation button, like "are you sure?" and then "yes" or "no" buttons for the larger purchases in game.   My 4 yo son came over and started pointing to the wisp mother and he touched the screen bringing up the rush option and he touched the screen again and spent 25 of my hard earned Flutterbucks with 2 fast clicks.  Was so bummed.  He was totally thrilled though and loved catching the cute little wisp babies so that was worth it.  But with that and the pollen (be careful when you scroll if your screen is very sensitive as you can easily select an option you didn't mean to!) It would be really nice to have a chance to say "oops".  :)  Those things are not a big deal though and take away no stars!   5/5 all the way.  Classy, fun, relaxing.  Love it.

I like the game - nice way to kill time with nice visuals and maybe learn a thing or two. What isn't so nice is when you make a purchase and what you purchased disappears. What a waste of money.

I really want to give it five stars, but it needs a few things. First, there are a few too many glitches on the free videos. I am already owed like ten Flutter bucks but didn't get them after watching video ads. Second, frog treats should appear more often. Notice that in starlight, you made that happen, so kudos on that. Last, make it a little easier to get epic and legendary flowers. I really want to collect as many butterflies as possible, that would really help. Oh and one more thing-- it would be awesome if we could visit our friends' forests...I know that may take some development changes, but it would truly take the game above and beyond. And for using features they included in another game (Splash), they reset that player's premium currency to 0!!  I'm still playing because I still like the GAME, but every time I am tempted to spend money, I rethink it. I've spent a tiny bit of money here or there for special events, but I've stopped spending the amount I used to. It may dwindle to NOTHING after what they've been doing to their players. Flutter has been very theraputic for me. This 'game' will educate you on the life cycle of the butterfly -from the egg to the catepillar, to chrysalis to the butterfly itself! That's not all: you will learn about its habitats, flowers and plants, functions yes, functions of particular butterflies.  ...Full ReviewFlutter has been very theraputic for me. This 'game' will educate you on the life cycle of the butterfly -from the egg to the catepillar, to chrysalis to the butterfly itself! That's not all: you will learn about its habitats, flowers and plants, functions yes, functions of particular butterflies.  The best part is that you nurture  and grow them in your very own rainforest! But there's so much more to it. You can interact with other players(when you want  to)who help you reach your goals!

Needs to have more expansions, but they are working on that. Technical support is helpful if needed, most of the time. Of course they are busy some times and their time is different than mine as well. But they do try their hardest to help players who are experiencing glitches or issues. They give u plenty of opportunities to get flutterbucks and they try to have events regularly, as so the long time players don't get bored. I recommend this app for those who want something relaxing and everlasting

It has a peaceful ambience -- I love to play Flutter before bed as a way to calm my mind (though I play throughout the day too, haha). Also, I have never seen a game that ...Full ReviewFlutter goes beyond your standard breeding game with thoughtful details like bug hunting, petal catching, and dandelion puffing. It has a peaceful ambience -- I love to play Flutter before bed as a way to calm my mind (though I play throughout the day too, haha). Also, I have never seen a game that includes so many free ways to gain the paid currency, which is amazing -- you can tell the game was made out of love and not as a money-grab.

In order to play with other people or be interactive at all it requires...Full ReviewIt's a great and fun game, and is even somewhat educational if you are willing to actually read and pay attention to the book in the game. My biggest problem with the game is that it doesn't tie into or use your Google+ account. In order to play with other people or be interactive at all it requires you to use a Facebook account. If I wanted to play a Facebook game, I would just play on Facebook. It used to have Google+ as an interactive connection, but since they upgraded, its removed that very key feature
